lines.text: Most of the time I just keep to myself. I think like what it would be like to be... someone else.
We're all really glad you're here.
Yeah we should do it again in like another 17 years.
There's this one dude on my floor, held a razor blade under his tongue for like 5 hours. He talked to the orderlies, he ate, everything.
Well, why on earth did he do that?
He was trying to break my record.
How could one sister be so good and the other so bad?
Oh my goodness, just look at you. Are you really that old?
Goofy carried me to Mickey's house?
I wish we could get along.
We do get along.
No I know but I mean really get along and be polite with one another.
We're Sisters.
We're going to see your Aunt Bessie in Florida. She's not feeling so well.
I didn't even knew I had an Aunt Bessie.
She came to the house right after your Dad and I were married.
I wasn't even born yet.
Oh.
You know how every goddamn Christmas I say, Looks like we didn't get a card again this year from your Aunt Bessie? Well, that's my sister Bessie.
Dad's dying. He's been doing it for about twenty years so I don't miss anything.
This is my sister we're talking about. We're not gonna let her die just so you can have one of your moods.
We call it the loony bin, or the nut house, to show that we've got a sense of humor about it.

[upon being asked to get out of the car]
They're having a top 100 countdown and I want to hear number 1.
What number are they up to?

[to her son]
My feelings for you, Hank, are like a big bowl of -
[sighs]
fish hooks. I can't just pick up one up at a time. I pick one up and they all come, so I just had to leave 'em alone.
Okay, Augustina... Is it okay if I call you Augustina?
Well, my name is Bessie.
[first lines]
Uh, Janine, I wonder if you could tell me how long I might have to wait, because I left Aunt Ruth at home in charge of dad, and...
You'll have to see Doctor Wally, because Doctor Serrot is on vacation.
[finishes typing "I quit" letter]
See "Doctor who"?
Oh, Lee, I've been so lucky. I've been so lucky to have Dad and Ruth. I've had such love in my life. You know, I look back, and I've had such... such love.
They love you very much.
No, that's not what I mean. No, no... I mean that I love them. I've been so lucky to have been able to love someone so much.
I could give a *fuck* about Disney World.
Are you behaving yourself?
Well, they're not strapping me down anymore.
Aunt Ruth, you're up and around.
Yeah, I'm part machine.
Don't waste your time trying to make friends with him. We're only going to be here a few days.
[last lines]
Bessie! Oh Bessie, you missed it. Coral finally married Lance!
But now, wasn't Lance married to Coral's mother?
No! Coral was married to Lance's father.
He's really a nice boy.
